{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Electrical and mechanical Technician",
  "description": "Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Electrical and mechanical Technician

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikorodu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a skilled and reliable Electrical &amp; Mechanical Technician to handle installation, maintenance, troubleshooting, and repair of electrical and mechanical systems.
	The ideal candidate should have hands-on technical experience, strong problem-solving skills, and the ability to work with minimal supervision.


Key Responsibilities


	Install, maintain, and repair electrical and mechanical equipment
	Diagnose faults and carry out corrective maintenance
	Perform routine inspections and preventive maintenance
	Ensure all work complies with safety and operational standards
	Read and interpret technical drawings and manuals
	Maintain records of maintenance activities and repairs
	Respond promptly to breakdowns and technical issues.


Requirements


	OND, HND, or Trade Test certificate in Electrical, Mechanical, or related field
	Proven experience as an electrical and/or mechanical technician
	Good knowledge of electrical wiring, motors, pumps, and mechanical systems
	Ability to use hand tools and diagnostic equipment
	Strong attention to detail and safety awareness
	Must be based in or willing to work in Ikorodu, Lagos.


Salary
200,000 &ndash; ?300,000 (Monthly)

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;Cv@ascentech.com.ng.ng&nbsp;using &quot;Electrical &amp; Mechanical Technician &ndash; 14&quot;&nbsp;as the subject of the mail.",

Electrical and mechanical Technician Job at Ascentech Services Limited




        
    

        
        Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Electrical and mechanical Technician

Job Location: Ikorodu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a skilled and reliable Electrical & Mechanical Technician to handle installation, maintenance, troubleshooting, and repair of electrical and mechanical systems.
	The ideal candidate should have hands-on technical experience, strong problem-solving skills, and the ability to work with minimal supervision.


Key Responsibilities


	Install, maintain, and repair electrical and mechanical equipment
	Diagnose faults and carry out corrective maintenance
	Perform routine inspections and preventive maintenance
	Ensure all work complies with safety and operational standards
	Read and interpret technical drawings and manuals
	Maintain records of maintenance activities and repairs
	Respond promptly to breakdowns and technical issues.


Requirements


	OND, HND, or Trade Test certificate in Electrical, Mechanical, or related field
	Proven experience as an electrical and/or mechanical technician
	Good knowledge of electrical wiring, motors, pumps, and mechanical systems
	Ability to use hand tools and diagnostic equipment
	Strong attention to detail and safety awareness
	Must be based in or willing to work in Ikorodu, Lagos.


Salary
200,000 – ?300,000 (Monthly)

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: Cv@ascentech.com.ng.ng using "Electrical & Mechanical Technician – 14" as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Job Vacancies at SPIE Oil & Gas Services
content:
SPIE Oil & Gas Services (part of the SPIE Group) provides a complete range of services to some of the world’s largest oil and gas companies through its network of offices in 25 countries across Africa, the Middle-East and Asia-Pacific.

Our turnover has more than doubled in the last few years thanks to the dedication of our 4,000 employees to whom we give training, recognition, and genuine opportunities for career development. In order to support this growth, SPIE Oil & Gas Services is always seeking talented individuals to join its teams.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) VIE - Management Controller
     

            
    



Job Location: Lagos
Duration: 2 years (early 02/02/2026).

Your mission


	Join SPIE Global Services Energy for a rewarding in Africa!
	SPIE Global Services Energy, a leader in Oil & Gas and Renewable Energies maintenance, is recruiting an H/F Management Controller for operations in offices in Lagos, Nigeria.


Main Missions 
A true right-hand man of the local DAF and essential link with the operational staff, he will assist him in the following missions:


	Participate in the monthly & annual closing of the accounts and make the link with the management account;
	Preparation of reporting to the parent company: order book ; income statement ; forecast at three sliding months ; customer credit ; provisions ...
	Report its analyses to the Local Management and Headquarters: explanations of the figures and variances observed each end of the month;
	Assist the DAF in monthly meetings with headquarters;
	In the budget phase: Participation in the preparation and analysis of annual budgets and re-forecasts;
	Business review and one-off participations in tenders;
	Participate in the development of procedures and continuous improvement of ERP in relation to the local Finance Department and headquarters


Your profile


	Coming from a training such as a Higher School of Commerce, specialized in Management Control and Accounting.
	Good level in accounting, will be tested.
	A double ESC-DCG degree would be very appreciated.
	First experience needed.
	Good knowledge in management monitoring, business monitoring and cost analysis (you will need to get involved quickly in everything that is followed reportingby cost accounting, reporting to the parent company and monitoring financial indicators.)
	Spoken and written languages: FrançaisFrench and English
	High computer sensitivity required: Office Pack and in particular Excel (formulas ;TCD ; Macros); ERP (Sage or other) ; BI (Essbase ; EPM or other);
	Communication and strong relational qualities to interact with local teams and headquarters;
	Rigorous; dynamic and pro-active.


Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) VIE - Deputy Project Manager - Operations Support

Job Location: Lagos

Job description


	Join SPIE Global Services Energy for an enriching VIE in Nigeria ! 
	SPIE Global Services Energy, leader in Oil & Gas and Renewable Energy maintenance, is recruiting a VIE (Volunteer for International Experience) Deputy Project Manager - Operations Support for operations based in Lagos Office, Nigeria + Offshore.


Main Missions 
True right-hand to the Local Project Coordinator and key link with field operations, he/she will support these core missions:


	QHSE Leadership: Achieve QHSE targets, implement SPIE OGS rules, drive continuous improvements, report risks
	Project Execution: Mobilize technical/human resources, manage rotations/training/logistics, oversee subcontractors
	Contract Success: Lead site meetings, supplier consultations, ensure standards compliance & profitability
	Innovation Driver: Focal point for Carbon Footprint Reduction Actions + propose innovations/prototyping.


Your Profile 


	Engineering degree (3-5 yrs exp. Business/Design Engineer preferred)
	Fluent English (Level D)
	Project management, communication, teamwork, risk analysis, Business sense
	MS Office proficient
	Knowledge in the maintenance/engineering field is a plus.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) VIE - Junior Tendering Coordinator

Job Location: Lagos

Main Missions
 True right-hand to the Local Project Coordinator and key link with field operations, he/she will support these core missions:


	Preparation of technical and commercial offers, in particular by ensuring that risks (technical, contractual, financial, HSE, etc.) are taken into account.
	He/she guarantees the relevance of technical and commercial offers while ensuring compliance with Group procedures, deadlines and customer requirements
	Comply with and ensure compliance with the QHSE rules, instructions and procedures
	Carry out the analysis of the call for tender and a synthesis in order to facilitate the decision whether to bid or not
	Prepare the first risk analysis of the call for tender
	Coordinate on all aspects (contractual and technical) from analysis of the clients call for tender up to contract award
	Manage the validation system
	Coordinate and ensure the delivery on time of full bids
	Ensure the compliance of the bidding as per the Corporate Process.


Standards:


	Comply with the tendering procedure (documents to prepare, level of approval with the required management level)
	Go through the CFT context/compliance, safety/security, scope of work, bid strategy, cost analysis, margin cash
	Ensure the implementation of the decisions taken during the tender approvals
	Organize a kick off meeting in collaboration with the various parties involved in the tender (support functions, service lines, the relevant
	stakeholders and the BU Manager)
	Coordinate the response to the call for tender with the various stakeholders defined during the kick off meeting
	Participate in the technical and commercial clarifications requested by the client during the call for tenders
	Animate the internal closure meetings
	Animate the validation of all contractual documents before signature
	Manage the transfer to operation team upon award
	Support the operations and contribute to the continuous improvement of the business.


Your Profile 


	Engineering degree (3-5 yrs exp. Business/Design Engineer preferred)
	Fluent English (Level D)
	Project management, communication, teamwork, risk analysis, Business sense
	MS Office proficient
	Knowledge in the maintenance/engineering field is a plus.


Click here to apply online    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Warehouse Manager",
  "description": "Deloxe is a forward-thinking human resources consulting firm dedicated to optimizing workforce potential and driving organizational success. We deliver innovative HR solutions that empower businesses, enhance employee experiences, and foster sustainable growth. At Deloxe, we are committed to transforming workplaces through strategic HR management and cutting-edge solutions that maximize efficiency and impact.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Calabar, Cross River&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	We are seeking an experienced and highly organized Warehouse Manager to oversee daily warehouse operations, including receiving, storage, inventory control, and dispatch of goods.
	The role requires strong leadership, attention to detail, and the ability to ensure operational efficiency, safety compliance, and timely order fulfillment.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan, organize, and supervise warehouse operations for efficient handling, storage, and distribution of goods.
	Maintain accurate inventory records using ERP/WMS systems and conduct regular stock counts.
	Develop and enforce standard operating procedures for receiving, picking, packing, and dispatch.
	Monitor warehouse KPIs such as inventory accuracy, order fulfillment, and turnaround time.
	Lead, train, and supervise warehouse staff to improve productivity and performance.
	Ensure compliance with safety regulations and maintain a clean, hazard-free warehouse environment.
	Identify process gaps and implement continuous improvement initiatives.
	Prepare routine operational and inventory reports.


Requirements &amp; Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3&ndash;4 years of experience managing warehouse operations.
	Strong knowledge of inventory control, warehouse processes, and safety standards.
	Experience using WMS/ERP systems.
	Good leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.
",

Warehouse Manager Job at Deloxe HR




        
    

        
        Deloxe is a forward-thinking human resources consulting firm dedicated to optimizing workforce potential and driving organizational success. We deliver innovative HR solutions that empower businesses, enhance employee experiences, and foster sustainable growth. At Deloxe, we are committed to transforming workplaces through strategic HR management and cutting-edge solutions that maximize efficiency and impact.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Manager

Job Location: Calabar, Cross River 
Employment Type: Full-time

Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking an experienced and highly organized Warehouse Manager to oversee daily warehouse operations, including receiving, storage, inventory control, and dispatch of goods.
	The role requires strong leadership, attention to detail, and the ability to ensure operational efficiency, safety compliance, and timely order fulfillment.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan, organize, and supervise warehouse operations for efficient handling, storage, and distribution of goods.
	Maintain accurate inventory records using ERP/WMS systems and conduct regular stock counts.
	Develop and enforce standard operating procedures for receiving, picking, packing, and dispatch.
	Monitor warehouse KPIs such as inventory accuracy, order fulfillment, and turnaround time.
	Lead, train, and supervise warehouse staff to improve productivity and performance.
	Ensure compliance with safety regulations and maintain a clean, hazard-free warehouse environment.
	Identify process gaps and implement continuous improvement initiatives.
	Prepare routine operational and inventory reports.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3–4 years of experience managing warehouse operations.
	Strong knowledge of inventory control, warehouse processes, and safety standards.
	Experience using WMS/ERP systems.
	Good leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

Our core markets consist of Real Estate, Hotel accommodation, Food &amp; Snack production, Commercial Truck and Buses manufacturing and distribution, Aftermarket Car Servicing, Inks for flexible packaging, Supplier of plumbing and industrial goods.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;HSE Officer

Job Location: Lagos

Responsibilities


	Develop and maintain HSE policies, procedures, and work instructions specific to transport and logistics operations (e.g., vehicle safety checks, loading/unloading procedures, driver safety protocols, warehouse safety).
	Ensure effective communication and dissemination of HSE information to all employees.
	Conduct regular risk assessments and hazard identification exercises across all transport and logistics activities, including driving, loading/unloading, warehousing, and maintenance. Identify potential hazards associated with vehicles, equipment, materials handling, and operational processes.
	Develop and implement appropriate risk control measures, including engineering controls, administrative controls, and personal protective equipment (PPE).&nbsp;


Requirements


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree or equivalent in Occupational Health and Safety, Environmental Science, Engineering, or a related field.
	At least 2-years of relevant experience in HSE management, preferably within the transport and logistics industry.
	Professional certification in HSE is highly desirable.
	Proven experience in conducting risk assessments, incident investigations, and HE audits. Excellent communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills.
	Proficiency in using Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@agleventis.com&nbsp;using &quot;Regional Internal Control Officer&quot; as the subject of the email.",

HSE Officer Job at A.G. Leventis




        
    

        
        A.G. Leventis (Nigeria) Limited provides West Africa with reliable, innovative & affordable products & services. Our core markets consist of Real Estate, Hotel accommodation, Food & Snack production, Commercial Truck and Buses manufacturing and distribution, Aftermarket Car Servicing, Inks for flexible packaging, Supplier of plumbing and industrial goods.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HSE Officer

Job Location: Lagos

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Develop and maintain HSE policies, procedures, and work instructions specific to transport and logistics operations (e.g., vehicle safety checks, loading/unloading procedures, driver safety protocols, warehouse safety).
	Ensure effective communication and dissemination of HSE information to all employees.
	Conduct regular risk assessments and hazard identification exercises across all transport and logistics activities, including driving, loading/unloading, warehousing, and maintenance. Identify potential hazards associated with vehicles, equipment, materials handling, and operational processes.
	Develop and implement appropriate risk control measures, including engineering controls, administrative controls, and personal protective equipment (PPE). 


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree or equivalent in Occupational Health and Safety, Environmental Science, Engineering, or a related field.
	At least 2-years of relevant experience in HSE management, preferably within the transport and logistics industry.
	Professional certification in HSE is highly desirable.
	Proven experience in conducting risk assessments, incident investigations, and HE audits. Excellent communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills.
	Proficiency in using Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@agleventis.com using "Regional Internal Control Officer" as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Business Development Executive",
  "description": "Worknigeria was established with a Singular Vision. To help the vast Nigerian workforce find meaningful jobs. We are also on a mission to upskill them in the best ways possible and help them grow with and within their careers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry:HR Consulting

Job Summary


	We are seeking a results-driven Business Development Executive to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for identifying new business opportunities, building strong client relationships, and driving revenue growth for our HR consulting services.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and develop new business opportunities to expand the companys client base.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with corporate clients, understanding their HR needs.
	Develop and implement strategic sales plans to meet revenue targets.
	Conduct market research to identify trends and competitive insights in HR consulting.
	Prepare and deliver compelling business proposals and presentations to potential clients.
	Collaborate with internal teams to develop tailored HR solutions for clients.
	Negotiate contracts and close deals to achieve sales targets.
	Maintain an up-to-date CRM database of leads, prospects, and clients.
	Represent the company at industry events, conferences, and networking opportunities.


Requirements


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Human Resources, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in business development, sales, or a related role, preferably in HR consulting or Service providing company.
	Strong understanding of HR services, including recruitment, training, and outsourcing.
	Proven track record of achieving and exceeding sales targets.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and CRM software.


Method of Application&nbsp;
&nbsp;Interested and qualified candidates should send CV&nbsp;to:&nbsp;careers@worknigeria.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2026-02-16",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "worknigeria"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",

    }

Business Development Executive Job at Worknigeria




        
    

        
        Worknigeria was established with a Singular Vision. To help the vast Nigerian workforce find meaningful jobs. We are also on a mission to upskill them in the best ways possible and help them grow with and within their careers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Executive

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry:HR Consulting

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a results-driven Business Development Executive to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for identifying new business opportunities, building strong client relationships, and driving revenue growth for our HR consulting services.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and develop new business opportunities to expand the companys client base.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with corporate clients, understanding their HR needs.
	Develop and implement strategic sales plans to meet revenue targets.
	Conduct market research to identify trends and competitive insights in HR consulting.
	Prepare and deliver compelling business proposals and presentations to potential clients.
	Collaborate with internal teams to develop tailored HR solutions for clients.
	Negotiate contracts and close deals to achieve sales targets.
	Maintain an up-to-date CRM database of leads, prospects, and clients.
	Represent the company at industry events, conferences, and networking opportunities.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Human Resources, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in business development, sales, or a related role, preferably in HR consulting or Service providing company.
	Strong understanding of HR services, including recruitment, training, and outsourcing.
	Proven track record of achieving and exceeding sales targets.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and CRM software.


Method of Application 
 Interested and qualified candidates should send CV to: careers@worknigeria.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply
